meanings.definition: To utter a low, usually nasal, complaining cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The puppy whines when it wants to go outside.
meanings.sent2: She always whines about having to do her homework.
meanings.sent3: The cat whines at the closed door, hoping someone will open it.
meanings.sent4: The wind whines through the trees on a stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The child's constant whines filled the room with a sense of discontent.

meanings.definition: A complaint uttered in a plaintive tone.
meanings.sent1: His constant whines about the food made everyone lose their appetite.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand the whines of her little brother anymore.
meanings.sent3: The whines of the students about the upcoming test were heard throughout the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The whines of the old car engine signaled it was time for a tune-up.
meanings.sent5: The whines of the violin added a melancholic touch to the music piece.
